page.title: 04BRADFORD CATHEDRAL
page.content:
The original church on this site was probably {built around the year 633.}A complete list of Vicars of Bradford starts in 1293. The {present building was built {around 1408} and the tower was added around 1500. In about 1666 a clock was placed in the tower and this was the {first public clock in Bradford.}
There are some beautiful {stained {glass windows.}The tower is 30 metres high. Around the Cathedral there is a big garden instead of a graveyard. People are no longer buried there. Each year about 20 weddings and funerals take place there. Services are held every day. Bells ring out before each service. Each week the bellringers practise. The Cathedral also has 20 choir boys and an orchestra.
